涼

Значения

Прохладный, освежающий; наслаждаться прохладой

Мнемоника

  • Столичная башня 京. Внутри всегда прохладно, т.к. высоко. Вода 氵 добавлена для усиления понятия «прохлада».

  • "Дождь охладил столицу 京."

humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and " jing ", the original meaning is thin wine. "Shuowen": "Bo Ye. From the water, the sound of Beijing." "Zhou Li‧Tianguan‧Xiangren": "The six drinks of the king of the palm: water, pulp, li, cold, medicine, elixir." Zheng Xuan noted Quoting Zheng Sinong said: "Cool, use water and wine."

" Cool " can mean thin and slight. "Poetry‧Daya‧Sangrou": "The people are extremely indifferent, and the post is cool and good." Mao Chuan: "Cool, thin."

" Cool " also means cold. "Poetry‧Bei Feng‧North Wind": "The north wind is cool, and the rain and snow are its scorpions."

" Cool " also means slightly cold and cool. Han Liuzhen's "Poems for Public Banquets": "Huaguan sends flow waves, open-minded and cool."

" Cool " also means sparsely populated and left out. Qi Kong Zhigui of the Southern Dynasties "Beishan Yiwen": "Jianshi destroys nothing and returns, and the stone path remains desolate."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " jing ", the original meaning is thin wine.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「京」聲，本義為薄酒。《說文》：「薄也。从水，京聲。」《周禮‧天官‧漿人》：「掌共王之六飲：水、漿、醴，涼、醫、酏。」鄭玄注引鄭司農曰：「涼，以水和酒也。」

　　「涼」可表示薄、輕微。《詩‧大雅‧桑柔》：「民之罔極，職涼善背。」毛傳：「涼，薄也。」

　　「涼」也表示寒冷。《詩‧邶風‧北風》：「北風其涼，雨雪其雱。」

　　「涼」還表示微寒、清涼。漢劉楨〈公宴詩〉：「華館寄流波，豁達來風涼。」

　　「涼」亦表示人煙稀少、冷落。南朝齊孔稚珪〈北山移文〉：「澗石摧絕無與歸，石逕荒涼徒延佇。」

涼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liáng］
［《廣韻》吕張切，平陽，來。］
［《廣韻》力讓切，去漾，來。］
亦作“凉1”。
(1)薄酒。
(2)薄；轻微。
(3)寒冷。
(4)微寒；清凉。
(5)指秋季。参见“涼天”、“涼月”。
(6)愁苦。
(7)比喻灰心、失望。
(8)人烟稀少；冷落。
(9)方言。舒适，痛快。
(10)通“”。杂色。
(11)国名。东晋十六国时期建立在今甘肃省一带的政权，国号皆称“凉”。有前凉、後凉、北凉、南凉、西凉等。
(12)州名。西汉置，辖境相当今甘肃宁夏和青海湟水流域。为汉武帝十三刺史部之一。参阅《晋书·地理志上》、《清一统志·涼州府一》。
(13)姓。三国魏有涼茂。见《三国志·魏志》本传。
[②]［liàng］
［《廣韻》力讓切，去漾，來。］
亦作“凉2”。
(1)把热东西放一会儿，使之变凉。
(2)把东西放在通风处使干燥。今作“晾”。
(3)方言。犹冷落，撇在一边。
(4)通“亮”。辅佐。
(5)通“諒”。参见“涼2陰”。

[①]［liáng］
["Guangyun" Lv Zhangqie, Binh Duong, come. ]
["Guangyun" force to cut, go to Yang, come. ]
Also known as "Cool 1".
(1) Thin wine.
(2) Thin; slight.
(3) Cold.
(4) Slightly cold; cool.
(5) Refers to autumn. See "cool sky", "cool moon".
(6) Sadness.
(7) An analogy of frustration and disappointment.
(8) Sparsely populated; left out.
(9) Dialects. Comfortable and happy.
(10) Pass "". Variegated.
(11) Country name. The regime established in the present-day Gansu Province during the Sixteen Kingdoms Period of the Eastern Jin Dynasty was called "liang". There are Qianliang, Houliang, Beiliang, Nanliang, Xiliang and so on.
(12) State name. Set in the Western Han Dynasty, it has jurisdiction over the Huangshui River Basin in Ningxia, Gansu and Qinghai. It is one of the thirteen governors of Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty. See "Book of Jin·Geography I", "Tongzhi of the Qing Dynasty·Liangzhou Prefecture No.1".
(13) Last name. Three Kingdoms Wei has Liangmao. See the biography of "Three Kingdoms·Weizhi".
[②]［liàng］
["Guangyun" force to cut, go to Yang, come. ]
Also known as "Cool 2".
(1) Put the hot thing for a while to make it cool.
(2) Put things in a ventilated place to dry them. This is "drying".
(3) Dialects. Still cold and left aside.
(4) Turn on "bright". Assisted.
(5) Through "forgiveness." See "Cool 2 Yin".
